text:
This is so bad.

1.0.4 It's getting better...

Update:
It's almost fine now. 
Shader compiling... it's better, but still takes time, about 20-30 min. And few crashes. Crash at shader compiling started after update 1.04, 5-6 crash in 1.0.4, now 1.0.5.1 it's about 2 crashes. After compiling game works fine, no crashes when gaming. 
After every game update, GPU driver update and game verify, it's compiling time :)

9900k, 32GB ram, Vega64 drivers 23.5.1, NVME SSD, Win10,

text:
Game looks and plays very well for me, 2080ti, Intel 5960 with 32GB ram. Almost didn't purchase it because of all the negative reviews.

Make sure to install new drivers before loading shaders; if you start up the game and it loads the shaders, when you install new drivers you'll need to reload the shaders, which is a PITA. So, if you get a notification about out of date drivers, quit out and download the drivers first, then load the shaders. Takes about an hour to load the shaders, but after that has been smooth sailing for me.

text: "The Last of Us Part 1" is a masterclass in storytelling and game design, delivering an unforgettable experience that resonates deeply with players. Naughty Dog's exceptional craftsmanship is evident in every aspect of the game, from the beautifully rendered post-apocalyptic environments to the deeply nuanced characters, brought to life through phenomenal voice acting and motion capture performances, particularly from Ashley Johnson and Troy Baker. The game’s narrative is a compelling blend of survival, sacrifice, and the complex bond between its protagonists, Joel and Ellie, making every moment of their journey emotionally gripping. The gameplay mechanics are thoughtfully integrated, combining stealth, combat, and exploration in a way that enhances the story rather than detracts from it. "The Last of Us Part 1" isn’t just a game; it’s a profound exploration of the human condition, making it a landmark achievement in the medium.

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
The Last of Us Part One stands as a beacon of excellence in the realm of video games, demonstrating an unparalleled blend of storytelling prowess, gameplay innovation, and artistic ingenuity. From the very first moments, the game immerses you in a post-apocalyptic world that feels disturbingly authentic, meticulously designed to convey a hauntingly beautiful yet bleak atmosphere.

The narrative unfolds with a masterful touch, taking you on an emotional rollercoaster that delves into the depths of human resilience, love, loss, and the complex shades of morality. Joel and Ellie, the central characters, are exceptionally well-crafted, each with their own flaws and strengths that make them incredibly relatable and real.

The gameplay seamlessly weaves intense action, strategic decision-making, and heart-pounding stealth, all within the confines of a carefully constructed world. The meticulously designed environments and intelligent AI create a sense of tension and immersion that keep you on the edge of your seat.

Visually, the game is a marvel, boasting impressive graphics that bring the world to life with stunning realism. The attention to detail in character expressions, environmental textures, and atmospheric effects contributes to a sense of believability rarely seen in gaming.

Moreover, the musical score, composed by Gustavo Santaolalla, is a masterpiece in itself. The haunting melodies and subtle tones perfectly complement the game's emotional beats, further enhancing the immersive experience.

In totality, The Last of Us Part One transcends the boundaries of a mere video game, encapsulating a narrative and gaming experience that will resonate with players long after they've put down the controller. It sets an extraordinary standard, defining what exceptional storytelling and gameplay can achieve in the gaming industry.

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
The Last of Us Part 1, developed by Naughty Dog, is a breathtaking and emotionally charged action-adventure game that has left a lasting impact on the gaming community. Released in 2013, it quickly became a classic, earning numerous awards and critical acclaim for its storytelling, gameplay, and graphics.

At the heart of The Last of Us Part 1 is its gripping and deeply emotional story. Set in a post-apocalyptic world where a fungal infection has devastated humanity, players follow the journey of Joel, a grizzled survivor, and Ellie, a young girl who may hold the key to a cure. The game masterfully weaves together themes of survival, love, loss, and morality, taking players on an emotional rollercoaster that tugs at the heartstrings.

The character development in The Last of Us Part 1 is exceptional, with Joel and Ellie being among the most memorable and well-crafted characters in video game history. Their relationship is at the core of the game, and their interactions are rich with nuance, authenticity, and raw emotion. As players guide them through the treacherous post-apocalyptic world, they become deeply invested in their journey, feeling the weight of their struggles and witnessing their growth and transformation.

The gameplay in The Last of Us Part 1 is a perfect blend of survival and action. Players must navigate through dangerous environments, scavenge for supplies, craft weapons, and engage in intense combat against both human enemies and infected creatures. The game strikes a delicate balance between stealth and action, requiring strategic thinking and resource management. The combat is visceral and intense, making every encounter a heart-pounding experience. The level design is superb, with detailed and immersive environments that add to the game's atmosphere and storytelling.

Visually, The Last of Us Part 1 is stunning. The graphics are top-notch, with detailed character models, breathtaking landscapes, and atmospheric lighting that create a realistic and immersive world. The attention to detail in the game's environments is remarkable, with each location telling its own story and adding to the overall narrative.

The Last of Us Part 1 also features a hauntingly beautiful musical score that complements the game's emotional beats perfectly. The voice acting is superb, with performances that are both authentic and heartfelt, further drawing players into the game's world.

One of the few criticisms of The Last of Us Part 1 is its linearity, with limited exploration and lack of player choice in the story. However, the game's tightly crafted narrative and character-driven focus more than make up for it, creating a cohesive and unforgettable experience.

In conclusion, The Last of Us Part 1 is a masterpiece of emotion and survival. Its gripping story, memorable characters, immersive gameplay, and stunning visuals come together to create a gaming experience that is both emotionally impactful and visually breathtaking. It is a game that will stay with players long after the credits roll, and a testament to the power of storytelling in video games. If you haven't experienced The Last of Us Part 1, it is a must-play for any gaming enthusiast looking for an unforgettable journey through a post-apocalyptic world.

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
"The Last of Us" isn't just a game; it's an unforgettable journey that transcends the boundaries of interactive entertainment. Developed by Naughty Dog and released in 2013, this masterpiece of storytelling and gameplay continues to captivate players worldwide with its gripping narrative and immersive world.

At its heart, "The Last of Us" is a testament to the power of storytelling. Set in a post-apocalyptic world overrun by a deadly fungal infection, the game follows Joel, a hardened survivor, and Ellie, a brave young girl immune to the disease, as they embark on a perilous cross-country journey. Their bond is the emotional anchor of the game, evolving amidst the ruins of society into a deeply moving tale of survival, sacrifice, and redemption.

Naughty Dog's attention to detail is evident in every aspect of the game, from its breathtakingly realistic environments to its meticulously crafted characters. The world of "The Last of Us" feels lived-in and authentic, teeming with both beauty and danger at every turn. Whether navigating the overgrown streets of a decaying city or confronting the horrors of the infected, players are immersed in a richly realized world that begs to be explored.

The gameplay mechanics of "The Last of Us" are equally impressive, offering a perfect blend of action, stealth, and survival elements. Combat encounters are tense and visceral, requiring players to utilize strategy and resourcefulness to overcome increasingly challenging obstacles. The crafting system adds depth to the experience, encouraging players to scavenge for materials and experiment with different strategies to survive in a hostile world.

One of the game's most remarkable achievements is its ability to evoke genuine emotion in players. From the haunting score composed by Gustavo Santaolalla to the nuanced performances of the voice actors, every aspect of "The Last of Us" is designed to tug at the heartstrings. Moments of triumph and tragedy alike resonate deeply, leaving a lasting impact on players long after the credits roll.

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
[h1]The masterpiece[/h1]

ㅤThe Last of Us is the masterful creation in the realm of video game storytelling. Originally released for PlayStation and later here on Steam, this game stands as a testament to the power of narrative-driven gaming experiences. At its core, The Last of Us delves into the human condition amidst a post-apocalyptic world ravaged by a fungal infection. The story follows Joel, a rugged survivor haunted by past traumas, and Ellie, a young girl immune to the infection. Their journey across the United States is not just a physical expedition but an emotional odyssey through loss, resilience, and the intricacies of their evolving relationship.

[h1]The game[/h1]

ㅤOne of the game's most compelling aspects is its character development. Joel's evolution from a broken man, consumed by grief and closed off emotionally, to a reluctant guardian with a newfound purpose is a testament to the game's nuanced storytelling. His complex morality and decisions he faces throughout the game challenge players to grapple with the blurred lines between right and wrong in desperate times.
ㅤEllie, on the other hand, represents hope and innocence in a world plagued by despair. Her growth from a vulnerable teenager to a resilient survivor mirrors the resilience of humanity in the face of adversity. Her interactions with Joel humanize both characters and create a deep emotional connection that drives the narrative forward.

[h1]The world[/h1]

ㅤThe world-building and attention to detail are outstanding. The desolate landscapes and hauntingly beautiful environments evoke a sense of isolation and danger, perfectly complementing the game's narrative. The meticulous design of the infected and the morally gray factions Joel and Ellie encounter adds layers of complexity to an already richly woven story.

[h1]The gameplay[/h1]

ㅤThe gameplay mechanics, seamlessly blending stealth, action, and exploration, serve as a vehicle to immerse players deeper into the narrative. The tension-filled combat sequences and the scarcity of resources force players to make strategic decisions, echoing the characters' struggles for survival in a hostile world.

[h1]The soundtrack[/h1]

ㅤThe musical score, composed by Gustavo Santaolalla, is a masterpiece in itself. Its haunting melodies and subtle undertones amplify the emotional impact of pivotal moments, enhancing the storytelling experience.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

ㅤIn essence, The Last of Us transcends the realm of video games, offering an emotionally charged, thought-provoking narrative that explores the depths of human relationships and the resilience of the human spirit. Its impact resonates far beyond the confines of gaming, solidifying its place as a landmark achievement in storytelling within the medium.

[h1]Rating[/h1]

ㅤ10000/10 - "Life altering"

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
Title: An Unforgettable Journey Through the Apocalypse: The Last of Us Part II Review

The Last of Us Part II, developed by Naughty Dog and released for the PlayStation 4, is not just a game; it's a monumental achievement in storytelling, gameplay, and emotional depth. This sequel to the critically acclaimed The Last of Us pushes the boundaries of video games as a medium for narrative, delivering a complex, heart-wrenching story that explores themes of revenge, grief, and the consequences of our choices.

From the outset, The Last of Us Part II immerses players in a beautifully crafted post-apocalyptic world that is both breathtaking and haunting. The attention to detail in the environments is staggering, from the overgrown urban landscapes of Seattle to the serene yet sinister forests. The game's visual storytelling is complemented by its use of light, shadow, and weather, creating a world that feels alive and incredibly immersive.

The gameplay in The Last of Us Part II is a masterful evolution of the first game's mechanics. Combat is intense and requires strategic thinking, blending stealth and action in a way that feels both challenging and rewarding. The game introduces new enemies and obstacles, requiring players to adapt and think creatively. The crafting and upgrade systems are refined, allowing for a greater sense of progression and customization.

However, where The Last of Us Part II truly shines is in its story and character development. The narrative is bold and unafraid to confront the player with difficult questions about humanity, morality, and the cycle of violence. The game's dual perspectives story, focusing on both Ellie and Abby, is a narrative gamble that pays off, offering a nuanced exploration of its themes and characters. The performances of the voice actors bring these characters to life with incredible depth and emotion, making their journeys feel intensely personal.

The Last of Us Part II also excels in its sound design and musical score. Gustavo Santaolalla returns to deliver another hauntingly beautiful soundtrack that perfectly captures the emotional tone of the game. The sound design adds to the immersion, with every environment filled with sounds that enhance the sense of place and the tension of the gameplay.

One of the most commendable aspects of The Last of Us Part II is its commitment to inclusivity and accessibility. The game features an extensive array of accessibility options, ensuring that players of all abilities can experience the story and gameplay. This commitment to inclusivity is a testament to Naughty Dog's dedication to the gaming community.

In conclusion, The Last of Us Part II is a masterpiece that transcends the medium of video games. It is a deeply emotional, thought-provoking, and unforgettable experience that challenges players to consider the depths of human emotion and the complexities of moral ambiguity. With its stunning visuals, innovative gameplay, and profound narrative, The Last of Us Part II sets a new benchmark for what video games can achieve in storytelling and emotional engagement. It is an essential experience for anyone who values the power of storytelling in games, and a testament to the artistic capabilities of the medium.

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
The Last of Us Part One is an extraordinary masterpiece that stands as a pinnacle of storytelling, game-play, and emotional depth in the gaming industry. Developed by Naughty Dog and released in 2013, this post-apocalyptic action-adventure game has left an indelible mark on players worldwide. From its gripping narrative to its stunning visuals, every aspect of The Last of Us Part One is a testament to the dedication and craftsmanship of its creators.

Captivating Storytelling:
At the heart of The Last of Us Part One lies an impeccably crafted and emotionally charged narrative. The game introduces us to Joel and Ellie, two unforgettable characters whose journey through a ravaged and dangerous world is both heartbreaking and inspiring. The writing is top-notch, with dialogue that feels natural and organic, drawing players into the story. The character development is exceptional, allowing us to form deep connections with the protagonists and other supporting cast members. The game tackles profound themes such as love, sacrifice, morality, and the human condition, making it a truly thought-provoking experience.

Unparalleled Emotional Impact:
The Last of Us Part One effortlessly pulls at your heartstrings, immersing you in a rollercoaster of emotions. The bond that develops between Joel and Ellie is incredibly poignant, as they navigate through the ruins of civilization together. The game explores the complexities of their relationship, evoking empathy and investment from the player. Moments of tenderness are juxtaposed with gut-wrenching scenes that force players to confront tough choices and grapple with the consequences of their actions. The emotional impact of The Last of Us Part One is unmatched, leaving players deeply affected long after the credits roll.

Immersive Atmosphere and Visual Splendor:
From the crumbling urban environments to the overgrown nature reclaiming the world, The Last of Us Part One presents a breathtakingly atmospheric post-apocalyptic setting. The level of detail in each environment is astonishing, immersing players in a hauntingly beautiful world. Whether you're exploring desolate cities or navigating through overgrown forests, every location feels meticulously crafted, enhancing the game's overall sense of realism. The attention to detail extends to the character models, animations, and facial expressions, making the interactions between characters feel lifelike and believable.

Superb Game-play and Engaging Mechanics:
The Last of Us Part One offers a seamless blend of intense action, stealth, and strategic game-play elements. Combat encounters are tense and require careful planning, as you scavenge for resources and utilize a wide array of weapons and tools. The stealth mechanics are particularly well-implemented, allowing for diverse play styles and strategic decision-making. Additionally, the game features puzzle-solving segments that provide a welcome change of pace, enhancing the overall game-play experience. The intuitive controls and responsive mechanics ensure that game-play remains consistently engaging throughout the entirety of the adventure.

Memorable Sound Design and Musical Score:
The Last of Us Part One boasts exceptional sound design, which serves to further immerse players in its world. From the haunting echoes of empty buildings to the subtle ambient noises of the wilderness, the audio creates a rich and believable atmosphere. The musical score, composed by Gustavo Santaolalla, perfectly complements the game's emotional tone. The acoustic guitar-driven melodies evoke a wide range of emotions, enhancing key moments and heightening the impact of the story.

Conclusion:
The Last of Us Part One stands as an iconic masterpiece in the gaming industry, seamlessly blending outstanding storytelling, immersive game-play, and breathtaking visuals. Naughty Dog's meticulous attention to detail, coupled with their commitment to delivering an emotionally resonant experience, has resulted in a game that transcends its medium. The Last of Us Part One is not just a game; it's an interactive work of art.

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
--SPOILER--

"The Last of Us Part 1,", stands as one of the most impactful and emotionally gripping games of its generation. This game combines masterful storytelling, nuanced characters, and intense gameplay to create a memorable experience.

Story and Characters:
The narrative is where "The Last of Us" truly shines. Set in a post-apocalyptic world ravaged by a fungal infection, the game follows Joel, a hardened survivor, and Ellie, a teenage girl who may hold the key to curing the infection. Their journey across a decimated United States is fraught with danger, both from infected creatures and desperate human factions. The relationship between Joel and Ellie is the emotional core of the game, evolving beautifully over the course of their harrowing journey. The writing is top-notch, and the voice acting by Troy Baker (Joel) and Ashley Johnson (Ellie) brings a profound depth to their characters.

Gameplay:
The gameplay is a blend of action-adventure and survival horror, with a strong emphasis on stealth. Resources are scarce, so players must scavenge for supplies and craft items to survive. Combat is tense and brutal, requiring strategic thinking and careful planning. The AI for both enemies and allies is impressively intelligent, adding to the immersion and challenge. The balance between combat and exploration is well-maintained, providing moments of intense action and quiet reflection.

Visuals and Sound:
Even years after its initial release, the game’s visuals remain stunning. The environments are richly detailed, from the overgrown urban landscapes to the haunting interiors of abandoned buildings. The remastered version enhances this further with improved textures, lighting, and frame rates. The sound design is equally impressive, with an atmospheric score by Gustavo Santaolalla that perfectly complements the game's emotional tone. The ambient sounds and character dialogues enhance the immersive experience.

Replayability:
"The Last of Us Part 1" offers a strong replay value with its compelling story, various difficulty levels, and additional modes like New Game Plus. Exploring different strategies and uncovering all the hidden collectibles provides ample reasons to revisit the game.

Conclusion:
"The Last of Us Part 1" is a masterpiece of storytelling and gameplay. Its emotional depth, complex characters, and immersive world make it a standout title that has left a lasting impact on the gaming industry. Whether you are experiencing it for the first time or replaying the remastered version, it remains a must-play game that showcases the very best of what the medium can achieve. Highly recommended!

keywords: last, character, experience, feel, gameplay, player, late, world, also, add
text:
The Last of Us: Part 1 Review - A Masterpiece of Emotional Storytelling and Survival Horror


-Introduction-

The Last of Us: Part 1, developed by Naughty Dog, is a critically acclaimed post-apocalyptic action-adventure game that took the gaming world by storm upon its release. Originally released for PlayStation consoles, the game's arrival on Steam has allowed a wider audience to experience the sheer brilliance of this emotional rollercoaster. With its compelling characters, harrowing atmosphere, and masterful storytelling, The Last of Us: Part 1 remains a timeless masterpiece.

-Story and Characters-

The Last of Us: Part 1 presents a deeply engaging and emotionally charged narrative set in a world ravaged by a fungal pandemic. Players assume the role of Joel, a hardened survivor, who must escort a young girl named Ellie across a dangerous and desolate landscape. The bond that develops between Joel and Ellie becomes the heart and soul of the game, as they face unimaginable challenges and confront the darkness lurking within humanity.

The storytelling in The Last of Us: Part 1 is exceptional, expertly weaving together moments of tenderness, heartbreak, and nail-biting tension. The characters are beautifully crafted, with complex motivations and realistic personalities that make them relatable and unforgettable. Naughty Dog's impeccable writing and the stellar performances of the voice actors breathe life into the characters, creating a profound emotional connection with the players.

-Gameplay and Survival Horror-

The Last of Us: Part 1 combines third-person action, exploration, and stealth mechanics to create a thrilling and immersive gameplay experience. Players must navigate through treacherous environments, scavenge for resources, and confront both infected creatures and hostile human factions. The gameplay seamlessly blends intense combat encounters with moments of quiet exploration, allowing players to strategize and adapt to their surroundings.

Stealth plays a crucial role in the game, as players must carefully navigate through dangerous areas, avoiding enemies or taking them out silently. The tension is palpable during stealth sequences, as every noise and misstep can alert enemies to your presence. The combat itself is visceral and intense, with a satisfying mix of gunplay, melee combat, and environmental tactics. The scarcity of resources adds an extra layer of tension, forcing players to make difficult choices and manage their inventory wisely.

-Visuals and Sound Design-

The Last of Us: Part 1 boasts stunning visuals that bring its post-apocalyptic world to life. The environments are beautifully detailed, with crumbling cities, overgrown nature, and hauntingly atmospheric locations. The attention to detail, from the weather effects to the dilapidated buildings, creates an immersive and believable world that pulls players deeper into the experience.

The sound design is equally impressive, with a haunting musical score that perfectly complements the game's tone and enhances the emotional impact of key moments. The voice acting is exceptional, delivering performances that are raw and believable, further immersing players in the emotional journey of the characters. The sounds of infected creatures, the crackling of gunfire, and the subtle ambient noises all contribute to the game's eerie atmosphere.

-Conclusion-

The Last of Us: Part 1 is a true masterpiece that exemplifies the potential of storytelling in video games. Its emotionally charged narrative, richly developed characters, and immersive gameplay mechanics make it an unforgettable experience. The game tackles themes of love, loss, and the human condition in a way that resonates deeply with players, leaving a lasting impact long after the credits roll.

Even though The Last of Us: Part 1 was originally released on PlayStation consoles, its arrival on Steam allows a wider audience to appreciate its brilliance. Whether you are a fan of survival horror, action-adventure games, or simply a lover of gripping narratives, The Last of Us: Part 1 is an essential addition to any gamer's library. Prepare to be moved, challenged, and enthralled as you embark on this unforgettable journey through the remains of a shattered world.

10/10 Skulls

text:
The Last of Us Part One is nothing short of a masterpiece in the gaming world. From the moment you start playing, you are immersed in a gripping narrative that seamlessly blends heart-wrenching emotion with intense action. The character development is exceptional, with Joel and Ellie's journey through a post-apocalyptic world leaving a lasting impact on players.

The attention to detail in the game is extraordinary, from the hauntingly beautiful landscapes to the meticulously crafted environments that tell a story of their own. The gameplay is both challenging and rewarding, with a perfect balance of stealth, strategy, and combat that keeps you on the edge of your seat.

What truly sets The Last of Us Part One apart is its emotional depth. The bond that forms between Joel and Ellie is portrayed with such authenticity that you can't help but become emotionally invested in their journey. The game explores themes of love, loss, and survival in a way that resonates long after the credits roll.

The soundtrack deserves special mention, as it enhances the overall experience, setting the mood for each moment and adding another layer to the storytelling. The voice acting is superb, bringing the characters to life in a way that is both believable and compelling.
